findings.title: Incorrect constructor name allows anyone to become owner
findings.explanation: The function DranMe is intended to be the constructor but is misspelled and thus treated as a regular public function. Anyone can call it to override the owner address.
findings.fix_suggestion: Rename the function from DranMe to DrainMe to match the contract name (or use the constructor keyword) so it is executed only once at deployment.

findings.title: Predictable randomness using blockhash
findings.explanation: The function uses keccak256(blockhash(block.number - 1)) which is predictable by miners and can be manipulated to influence winner selection.
findings.fix_suggestion: Use a secure randomness source such as Chainlink VRF or a commit-reveal scheme to prevent miner manipulation.

findings.title: Possible division by zero due to mutable seed values
findings.explanation: The calculation `_seed / (seed[0] * seed[1])` can divide by zero if either seed[0] or seed[1] is zero or if seed array is resized to length < 2 via addSeed, causing a revert.
findings.fix_suggestion: Validate that seed[0] and seed[1] are non-zero before performing division, and restrict arbitrary resizing or setting of seed values.

findings.title: Unreachable code in guessSeed
findings.explanation: The `return` statement appears before the conditional block, making the `if` statement unreachable and its logic never executed.
findings.fix_suggestion: Move or remove the early return so that the conditional comparison and state update can be reached as intended.

findings.title: Unchecked call return value in winPrize
findings.explanation: Using low-level `call` without checking its return value can lead to silent failures in Ether transfer, preventing the owner from receiving funds without notice.
findings.fix_suggestion: Check the boolean return value of `call` and revert on failure, or use `transfer`/`send` which revert on failure by default.

unmatched_predictions.title: Incorrect constructor name allows anyone to become owner
Possible division by zero due to mutable seed values
Unchecked call return value in winPrize
